summary.para: Contains disk block reassignment data. This is a variable length structure where the last member is an array of block numbers to be reassigned. It is used by the IOCTL_DISK_REASSIGN_BLOCKS control code.

remarks.para: The REASSIGN_BLOCKS structure only supports drives where the Logical Block Address (LBA) is a 4-byte value (typically up to 2 TB).
For larger drives the structure that is used with the IOCTL_DISK_REASSIGN_BLOCKS_EX control code supports 8-byte LBAs.
For device compatibility, the IOCTL_DISK_REASSIGN_BLOCKS control code and REASSIGN_BLOCKS structure should be used where possible.

summary.para: This member is reserved. Do not use it. Set it to zero.
The number of blocks to be reassigned.
This is the number of elements that are in the BlockNumber member array.
An array of Count block numbers, one for each block to be reassigned.
